reviewText:
Generally I cannot recommend this game. I was a MASSIVE, repeat, MASSIVE fan of Max Payne 1.

I find the mouse controls here either too cumbersome or too responsive, no sweet spot.

Enemies have a tendancy to be incredibly accurate. Ducking and shooting around obstacles can be challenging, particularly as the enemy seems to be able to hit you when an obstacle won't allow you to aim.

The weapon swap, drop and selection is among the worst I have ever encountered in a TPS.

But the thing that drives me the craziest? The immersive world is just so detailed it can be mighty difficult to figure out where the enemy is whilst being shot at. Yet they seem to always know exactly where you are...

A pretty big disappointment this one.

reviewText:
Wonderful production values  that sadly did not extend to quality control in regards to game play. The non-stop cut scenes and irregular pacing ruin the fun all the time. You want to move down a corridor and get ready to dive in and bullet time? No, sorry cut scene tedium then some action when you're deliberately set up in a very bad position.. Also the script makes no sense , for example .when one hostage is inside a room bullet time is not allowed and instead contrived cut scene and  they get shot instead. You have already blitzed worse, killed hundreds of commandos, yet this room somehow disables it all for a very contrived plot point.
My major complaint is the removal of player agency. Sorry had enough of being contrived into a bad position for a gun fight. If I wanted a rail shooter I'd go play something good like Time Crises.
One for the Steam sale if you must buy. Also you have a useless partner who does sweet FA in fights. Being forced into a cut scene then into a fight reducing your options? no thanks I like as a player being able to move cover to cover etc. and set up rather than be stuck into fight after fight in narrow short sections then yet into another cut scene.
Having played the other two in the series  I can only but disapprove of this one, although this one has superior production values the annoying cut scenes detract greatly from the fun. Also Rockstar Social club is needed. It's like a rail shooter masquerading as 3rd person shooter but being awful, Verdict? Kobold wants his money back :(

reviewText: I was a huge fan of the first 2 Max Payne games, but this is not a really good game. I think the storyline was poor, at best. Max Payne was never the type of guy that would be a gun for hire and would risk his entire life for a paycheck by some rich people. The original Max Payne had a motive that could connect you and would make you want to advance. This just didn't have it. Add to that the fact that the game is very short and predictable. It's only 14 chapters, which I flew by in a day and a half. Then top that with the fact that there is no true thinking involved in the game. It's just go to the next room and shoot. There are no puzzles or ways to strategize. Point, shoot, end. Very disappointed with this game.

reviewText:
Masterpiece.
An absolute must for people who like Max Payne or Max Payne 2.
For an action-game fan, who hasn't played the first games and doesn't know the story, this game still an excellent choice.

Max Payne 3 is what you could call a full package.
It has excellent graphics, while remaining playable on lower end systems thanks to the variety of graphics controls.
The story is just.... addicting, makes you feel like you are playing in a movie.
The presentation is very original, while preserving the feel of the older Max Payne franchise. The graphic novel feel is still there, and Bullet Time is better than ever.

The game has high replay value, since play styles are so different on every difficulty level and it has an Arcade mode, which again lets you play the game with new play styles and compete against other people for highscores.

And if you ever get tired of singleplayer, which is unlikely, you can switch to multiplayer, which again offers endless hours of gameplay, character and loadout customization and unique elements (like Bullet Time).

reviewText:
This game is a hybrid of film and interactivity, it has a linear plot unraveled through gameplay that your player choices have no consequence over.

Pros:
Excellent narrative and voice delivery. The central character is well developed.
Bullet time is still fun, even though its showing its age as a 'Matrix' gimmick.

Cons:
Falls prey to the 'Press X to block, Press Y to disarm' sections - an uncreative and uninteresting solution to a game problem.
Toward the latter part of the story suffers from frustrating repetitive bottleneck sections.
Lack of player agency; you are essentially an automaton pressing buttons to advance the story.

I bought this in the steam sale, I've completed the single player but I have no intention of giving it a second play-through or playing multiplayer. If you intend on doing the same then consider it a few days of entertainment at a fraction of the price of a cinema ticket. Overall I'd say the experience was worth it to those interested in how the central character has developed in the third instalment of the franchise. Essentially buy it for the story, not for the gameplay.

reviewText:
The original Max Payne games were fantastic, and still fun, but show their age a little. Max Payne 3 successfully manages to modernise the gameplay and the character himself.

This is one of the few game series with a large focus on story but set in the time of their release. So Max ain't what he used to be. Max's drunken drugged face looks suitably like ♥♥♥. The majority of the locations are completely different to what you would expect in a Max Payne game. The heat of Brazil in contrast to the snowy nights of New York. The story itself is not related to Max's past but the arc is personal to Max. It's satisfying. Cutscenes are very nicely edited and at a good length. I was quite happy sitting back watching these scenes in-between the action.

The gunplay is just a joy. There's slow-mo you can activate anytime but only acquire from hitting your shots right. There's also unlimited slow-mo by diving around everywhere which may sound like a cop-out but, depending where you jump, you may be exposing yourself and you need to get  back up. That might sound funny, Max takes a moment to get back up. Old ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Despite the slow-mo capabilities the game is not easy. The latter half there are many parts where you are very limited with ammo. Areas can be swarming with enemies, at different heights, and with little cover and little ammo it's just thrilling. You need to nail every bullet near the end. Or on Hard. The Hard difficulty truly is elitist stuff here. There was one moment which was a bit cheaky but excused due to the quality of the full game. Having all these odds pit against you and throwing yourself into these areas all to the beat of the sweet gun porn in action, it's fantastic stuff. It forces you into becoming a good player by taking big risks.

Noir monologues, guns and imperfect people. It's worth playing.

reviewText:
After playing all 3 games i'm kind of stuck on which one I like, so I figured i'd just do the 3rd one and maybe the others later on.

PROS:

Still feels like Max Payne: Even though Remedy isn't doing this game it still feels like it's actually Max Payne, still that gritty and amazing voice, all of those great lines he does, i'm glad Rockstar could actually capture how he is even though Remedy isn't doing it anymore.

Clues: Around the maps there are clues that can tell the story or show what has happened in certain areas, although some are a little odd, or don't make too much sense, but they are pretty neat to go around and try to find.

Golden Guns: If you roam around the maps and try to find golden parts for certain guns, you can get a golden gun which does more damage, and it can be pretty useful, although some are in some weird spots, or are just obvious and they aren't.

Great story: You will probably need to play the other games to know a little bit about Max's backstory in this game, there are a lot of references going back to older games, and this story is about how Max went from New Jersey into Brazil and him being a bodyguard for a rich family, and of course, knowing Max's luck, it never goes as well as he'd like.

Good sounding weapons: All of the weapons actually do some damage, and sound very gruesome too, even the pistols and really weak damaging guns actually sound like they are doing some damage.

Flashbacks: At certain points Max will have flashbacks to certain areas, these can be from when he was in Jersey to where he first got to Brazil, and seeing what had happened at these certain points to tell you more of the story that's unfolding.

CONS:

Waste of pills: I've realized this, as I was playing if you take pills normally you get half your health back, but if you have pills on you, get shot down into last stand mode, and kill the enemy that killed you, you get 3/4's of your health back, and waste a pill, so why the heII should I bother using the pills regularly and get less health back when I can kill them in last stand mode and get more health back, and then be invulnerable for a few seconds to get up and get into cover? I think they should have done it like this, if you get knocked into last stand mode, you use a pill, kill a guy, and you get half health, if you use a pill normally you get full health or 3/4's of your health back, making it to where it still feels like max payne and not stupid CoD.

Barely used Bullet Dodge: While I was playing I actually hardly used my bullet dodge, cause Max takes for f*%king ever to get back up and I ended up dieing from that, or dieing while in mid air dodging, so I figured Why use bullet dodge if I can just sit behind cover and blind fire them

reviewText:
a really enjoyable, underrated title to end Max's trilogy. fun over-the-top gameplay antics with lots of setpieces that would - in real life - be the subject of international news every time Max gets to work.

the characters, writing, dialogue, voice acting, guns and level design are on par with R* standards and while the campaign is a bit short there are some replay incentives. the Brazilian environment is a contrast to the usual gritty, noir, concrete style of Hoboken which results in a more lush, green, bright, open, dilapidated, uneven landscape. a couple flashback levels are thrown in so you still get that original feel and offers a nice mixup.

my main gripes are the loading times, bullet time doesn't last long enough (if you dive and hit a wall, chair, etc bullet time will end) and half the cutscenes are unskippable or take a while to skip, which is immensely annoying when you have to retry the part or whole level (eg. New York Minute mode). also when Max recovers from a second wind, he will fully stand up instead of going to cover which meant more unnecessary damage, pill usage and facepalming.

all in all a worthy title to play and definitely worth it if you can find it for $15 or less.

reviewText: From the esteemed offices of TaleWords comes the latest hijinks in Max Payne's mischief-laden life. So it’s magnificently to Bethesda’s credit that its semi-staged concert version of this bottomlessly challenging work reaches its half-way mark with all colours flying. And this, despite last-minute panic when the scheduled Pandemic fell ill and was replaced by NeverSoft, who had arrived from existance only hours before the performance and was to all intents unrehearsed. No matter, because they were terrific: confident, committed, clarion-voiced and could model like a pro.

This is one of the few game series with a large focus on story but set in the time of their release. So Max ain't what he used to be. Max's drunken drugged face looks suitably like ♥♥♥. The majority of the locations are completely different to what you would expect in a Max Payne game. The heat of Brazil in contrast to the snowy nights of New York. The story itself is not related to Max's past but the arc is personal to Max. It's satisfying. Cutscenes are very nicely edited and at a good length. reviewText: Max Payne 3, a game as action filled as revolutionary. In terms of technology, Max Payne 3 features a revamped brand new engine build from the ground up. This engine allows Max to perform all kinds of movement in terms of combat. For example, you can shootdodge and then get up and continue on using BulletTime (c). Also, the story is revolutionary as well. Using different camera angles help you feel like you are Max. To top it off, there are moments there where BulletTime (c) is used, to perform final kill cams. I would really reccommend this game to anyone from FPS players to MMO players who consider themselves gamers. I haven't got anything to say about multiplayer, as it's empty.

reviewText:
Max Payne, he was a drunken son of a ♥♥♥♥♥ who got dealt a terrible ♥♥♥♥ing hand. The destructive emotion of entropy had not one drop of sympathy for Max Payne. Since the first one to this most recent third game of the series. Max, I would like to think of as a good friend by now (considering what we've gone through), was a man filled with so many conflicting qualities that whether it was in the heat of a slow-motion shootout against paramilitary drug cartels, or, the dreadful conversations with stoned secondary plot characters. I found myself tired of it all.

As if, I ask, what was it all really for? I mean, who cares if this rich family has their own story of murder, corruption, deception and the likes. I would of walked away as soon as I would of been given the cue. Yet, alas, my conscious kicked in. “It was my fault. I should redeem myself.” This is the defining reasoning for Payne's actions for a huge majority of the game. That is until the story takes a few twists and turns that end up creating more questions than answers. This left many questions unanswered, and a sense of disappointment at the end. The story is 50/50. At times it is genuinely interesting, other times it is ridiculous and mundane. What really saves this game's story is Max Payne's inner dialogue. [6/10]

The graphics are most definitely stunning (check out my images, I have many pictures from the game I played through). If you happen not to clip through many of the hard edges of seemingly soft structures, you will definitely enjoy some spectacular moments of Max PayneTM. An array of various environments, such as Brazilian slums, stadiums, roof-decks, to airports, classic streets of New Jersey, and even deep into the rainforest. In many ways the ambiance and environment help in engrossing you into the game. In particular, I enjoy the pre- & post- 'conflict pictures of various environments. Seeing all paper, sparks, bottles, glass, explosions and the rest of the enjoyable destructible environment is an always enjoyable experience. [8.5/10]

There is definitely enjoyment in the game-play, I would just say that it doesn't last long. It is essentially superficial, point and click with timed jumps. To be fair, the whole series is as such, although in this one, they included this cover system which isn't as smooth as they clearly wanted it to be. Especially if you run out of bullet-time (which will happen if your playing on hard.) Sometimes I felt like I was grinding through this game. Just to get it done. I would remember the exact spots the officers appeared, and death after death, i would go through the best motion to kill as many as possible with my bullet time, before having to take cover, and frantically move the camera around to find the remaining soldiers. I died so much that sometimes I completely forgot why I was in that situation, and where and what I was doing. You can see that I have 11.5 hours, not much. To be honest, I can't force myself to play a game. That is a genuine sign of a problem in the game-play mechanics and their fluidity. [6/10]

All in all, this game is worth it, especially if your a Max Payne fan. It's not worth a full price game but it is worth it a discounted price. It has it's appeals of explosions and the classic mutterings of Max Payne. What I enjoyed about the previous games is that I truly did sympathize with Max Payne. Those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and what they did to him and his family, was disgusting, and I was going to pick up every gun available to help bring vengeance into Max's hands. Until we both felt the accumulative wrath of our own actions, retribution shot back at us, through more torment and pain. Until Max stopped, nothing else would...In this game, it wasn't as personal. It wasn't as believable to go out and do all this for some schmucks, who were entwined in their ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. I'd give this game a [7.5/10]. Its a worthwhile play through, although I wouldn't say it holds that much more appeal.





Here are some of those great moments of Max that I was talking about:

I was a dumb American in a place where dumb Americans are less popular than the clap...

I might have written the book on bad ideas, but Passos wasn't afraid to quote from it....

So I guess I'd become what they wanted me to be, a killer. Some rent-a-clown with a gun who puts holes in other bad guys. Well that's what they had paid for, so in the end that's what they got. Say what you want about Americans but we understand capitalism. You buy yourself a product and you get what you pay for, and these chumps had paid for some angry gringo without the sensibilities to know right from wrong. Here I was about to execute this poor ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ like some dime store angel of death and I realized they were correct, I wouldn't know right from wrong if one of them was helping the poor and the other was banging my sister...

I'd killed more cops than cholesterol and still no sign of Becker. It wasn't the first time it dawned on me I should probably have gone over the plan in more detail, but it was too late for that now.

The smell in this place reminded me of how long it had been since I'd had any food. A drinker eats when he's loaded. A real drunk eats when he's not.

Yup, very well written lines...For the Max Payne character.

reviewText: It'd been years since I'd played Max Payne 2, years since I'd felt anything but regret. By the time it came out I was too deep in the bottle to remember if it had ever been worth it. Maybe I'd play the game, or maybe I'd be the one who was played; an out of tune deadbeat that's worth nothing more than the 60 bucks in his wallet. I paid the money - what the hell else was I gonna do? They'd gotten me. An overdue port of a washed up franchise, and I'd given in like the sucker they'd pegged me for. I wanted answers. I decided to kill my way to the truth, just like old times.\n\nI wanted to beat the game like a drunk beats his wife - over and over. Then the truth hit me like a double-barreled shotgun straight to the face; unskippable cutscenes. Time seemed to slow down as I hit enter almost as much as I hit the bottle. This single crack threatened to shatter the whole picture, a bright, flickering picture of bullets going into a man's face, a picture that looked remarkably like Man On Fire.

reviewText:
Masterpiece.
An absolute must for people who like Max Payne or Max Payne 2.
For an action-game fan, who hasn't played the first games and doesn't know the story, this game still an excellent choice.

Max Payne 3 is what you could call a full package.
It has excellent graphics, while remaining playable on lower end systems thanks to the variety of graphics controls.
The story is just.... addicting, makes you feel like you are playing in a movie.
The presentation is very original, while preserving the feel of the older Max Payne franchise. The graphic novel feel is still there, and Bullet Time is better than ever.

The game has high replay value, since play styles are so different on every difficulty level and it has an Arcade mode, which again lets you play the game with new play styles and compete against other people for highscores.

And if you ever get tired of singleplayer, which is unlikely, you can switch to multiplayer, which again offers endless hours of gameplay, character and loadout customization and unique elements (like Bullet Time).

reviewText:
The hard-boiled detective is back, but is this the same Max that we've seen in before?

A new Max Payne game! Set in Brazil!? I have to admit that I was perplexed, perhaps even turned off at this idea when I initially heard about it. After all, Max Payne had established itself as a melodramatic noir crime story set in New York City, the complete opposite of its new sunny, colorful, Brazilian setting. Along with the new setting there were also new developers, while previous titles were handled by Finnish studio Remedy Games, Max Payne 3 was being developed by an internal Rockstar studio in Vancouver. This definitely raised a few eyebrows, mine especially. How did it all turn out?

Wonderfully.

Max has never felt better. Controls are snappy. The animations are some of the best I've ever seen in gaming. The story is a little lacking, but all we really needed is Max with guns, truckloads of bad guys, and bullet time.

The dark and brooding atmosphere of the first two games is replaced by an aesthetic that closely resembles a Tony Scott film, particularly the film Man on Fire. There are a lot of filmic effects overlayed on the cutscenes that distort and blur the shots as they are framed off, highlighting key moments and important plot points. The combination of these effects gives the production it's own unique feel.

Overall a must play of ANY action game enthusiast.

reviewText:
Max Payne is back and oh boy is he back with a vengeance.  He is still the same old Max; pills, alcohol and still in love with pain. This time around you get a deeper connection and understanding of who Max is and what he has gone through. You feel bad for him and at the same time you understand why he acts the way he does.

Combat as usual is something that is better experienced then it is for me to try and explain in words. The original bullet time combat in the game world is back and will leave you missing it after you have completed the game.

The overall visuals and audio are both well done; neither is lacking in any sense. Difficulty can be had at times but overall the game isn't to tough to run through. I didn't get a chance to play the multi-player but to be honest in a game like this; it isn't needed or desired.

If you want a great story that has great gun fights and a character that has you both on the edge of your seat and pitying; then Max Payne 3 is for you.


+ Bullet time
+ Great character story
+ Great gunfights
+ Perfect game length
- Some boring npcs
- Some levels were repetitive


Score: 8.5 out of 10

reviewText:
a really enjoyable, underrated title to end Max's trilogy. fun over-the-top gameplay antics with lots of setpieces that would - in real life - be the subject of international news every time Max gets to work.

the characters, writing, dialogue, voice acting, guns and level design are on par with R* standards and while the campaign is a bit short there are some replay incentives. the Brazilian environment is a contrast to the usual gritty, noir, concrete style of Hoboken which results in a more lush, green, bright, open, dilapidated, uneven landscape. a couple flashback levels are thrown in so you still get that original feel and offers a nice mixup.

my main gripes are the loading times, bullet time doesn't last long enough (if you dive and hit a wall, chair, etc bullet time will end) and half the cutscenes are unskippable or take a while to skip, which is immensely annoying when you have to retry the part or whole level (eg. New York Minute mode). also when Max recovers from a second wind, he will fully stand up instead of going to cover which meant more unnecessary damage, pill usage and facepalming.

all in all a worthy title to play and definitely worth it if you can find it for $15 or less.

reviewText: Disturbing, linear, cinematic story driven game with awesome graphics and great gameplay! For those having issues with Rockstars Social Club there is a fix. Right click on Max Payne 3, go into properties, click on launch settings, type -windowed and it will force the game to launch in a windowed mode. reviewText:
The single player campaign is great and the game is worth it just for that. The game is relatively bug free, only encountered two or three bugs during the whole single player part. The arcade modes expand on the single player experience which is a great feature for those who enjoy single player over multiplayer; the only downside is, that the global leaderboards are kind of useless because R* does not police them, at least last time I checked.

As for multiplayer, I only briefly gave it a try, if you find the right people it can be good fun. The co-op mode you get from one of the DLCs is great if you have a friend you can play with.

Overall Max Payne 3 is a very well made game and anyone who enjoys third person shooters should give it a try, especially for the great price the game often goes for on Steam Sales.

reviewText:
Max Payne 3, the game that is so harshly judged for so many unreasonable reasons. Me, myself, never played MP1 or MP2, so my review will be unbiased and will not be comparing this to the previous games.

Pros:

+ Easily one of the better looking games in my library. The visuals and effects are stunning
+ I like the realistic way of handling weapons; two handguns and a primary (rifle, shotgun, etc.), although you can dual-wield the handguns but must drop the primary in order to do so
+ The bullet time is limited, which means you must use it wisely
+ Pretty interesting plot, will leave you interested for the most part
+ The characters are likeable, although a couple will annoy you (which they're intended to)

Cons:

- The multiplayer is sub-par and quickly gets boring
- Rockstar's Social Club
- Take my hours above and subtract about an hour or two for the length of the story; I was playing on Normal, so the playtime may vary for you depending on how good you are and what difficulty you choose
- The game's got some weird flashing and editing crap piled onto the drunken scenes with Max, so beware those that suffer from sezuires
- YOU WILL CRY AND SHOOT SOMETHING AT THE DIFFICULTY OF THIS GAME (not a con for me, but a con for most so RIP)

Overall, I'd give this game on a good day an 8/10.

reviewText:
Campaign clocks in at around 8-10 hours and is about par for the length of most modern big-budget shooters in the market.

Game uses an optimised Euphoria engine - first debuted by the Grand Theft Auto 4 installments. Copious amounts of motion capture work has been put into this game and it helps to overcome the general floatiness/sluggishness of procedurally-generated movement that GTA4 was known for. A particularly striking moment would be a peripheral segment in the Brazilian slums with a trio of young aspiring footballers having a kickabout.  Being powered with an infrastructure meant for open-world games does come with a trade-off in the form of load times (masked by lengthy unskippable cutscenes). Replayability suffers as a result of the aforementioned loading.

Gunplay matches the best in franchise to date with extremely responsive controls and the return of the shoot-dodge/bullet-time maneuvres. Aiming returns to the era where projectiles travel dead centre without any deviation/spread. Weapon variety covers your usual fare of pistols, submachine guns and rifles - with an option to dual-wield with the lesser firearms. Levels provide cover generously by design and feature believable architecture that serves to mimick their real life counterparts as opposed to a seemingly random assortment of crates and walls. The game is also punctuated by a few rail shooter segments and chase sequences which are placed appropriately and definitely do not overstay their welcome.

Max Payne 3 is presented via a heavy use of cutscenes as opposed to the unique comic-book approach adopted by Max Payne 1 & 2. While the departure from its origins can be somewhat jarring to diehard fans, the cinematics ingame are well-directed and acted out by a competent cast of voice actors. Max himself still comes with a full arsenal of monologic quips and one-liners that he is most fondly remembered by.

Worth full price? Maybe. Worth discounted price? Definitely. For those sitting on the fence and leery over the prospects of playing a sequel that has been developed by none of the old guard, the near-decade wait is finally over and it has certainly not been in vain.

But multiplayer is down (for me I think, because i cant find a game), even if you find a game it will be filled with hackers.So if you're going to play multiplayer don't play it, play co-op (if you have the dlc).

Pros:
-Story is really good but don't expect a story like Max Payne 1's or Max Payne 2's.
-Gameplay is really good but its not like good old Max Payne series, its a bit different.

Cons:
-Old bullet-time was better.
-Being able to carry only one gun and two different small weapon is bad, even if its realistic.
-Multiplayer is down.Even if you find a game to play.It will be filled with hackers as I said.
-You will not be able to play multiplayer so just buy the DLC with co-op levels one (if you have a friend to play it).

Thats all for me.Its my first serious review.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I definetly recommend this game to everyone that lives on planet Earth, and here's why:

Story: Great story with a big plotwist and sequences from the past as a great backstory, clues found around the map as a collectible that gives even more backstory/information. 12/10

Gameplay: Third-person shooters are always fun and with the addition to bulletime you cant really go wrong with that. because the gameplay in this game is amazing with the famous bulletime that you will you almost all the time will keep your blood preasure going. Now if you are worried about if in this game isnt enough weapons then you are wrong there is a lot of them and they are really fun to use, especially when you collect golden parts for weapons so your weapons will be gold plated (i think that is a nice addition to it :D ). 10/10

Graphics: The graphics are smooth and nice to look at, but in 2015 its not that much of a wow but games get older as us do and i am not personally like a graphics ♥♥♥♥♥ (explosions do look really good i must admit :D ) 8/10 - 2015 10/10 - 2012

Level Design - This game has really detailed seroundings alltho i would really love to see Max Payne 4 in a open world because in this game you cant really go anywhere exept forward (its liniar thats what i am trying to say XD ) and i was hoping that i could explore some of these locations more like the Panama or New Jersey and other places that are in the game but i guess thats how it goes in Max Payne games. 8/10

SoundTrack - Now this game has an AMAZING soundtrack that follows tension,action and the desperate times of Max Payne that you really feel for his loss and that you understand why he cant get over it. 10/10

AI - The Enemies are smart,they will hide behind corners or other things and will proceed with caution and strike only at the right time,sometimes they will even charge you to force you to flee or shoot them (depending on difficulty level)
9/10

Difficulty Level - Speaking of difficulty i must say its pretty hard on higher difficulties then normal (if you get shot 2 times on hard difficulty you are down) but its not that bad as it sounds like because you can find a plenty" of painkillers around the level that will help you stay alive. If you will go down you will be in a mode that i called "shoot for your life mode" that is simular to Borderlands one
date: basically what you need to do is to kill the guy that shot you to "earn your life"\n(if you dont have painkillers you will just die) but there is a little problem with this mode
recommended:
when someone gets you down and he has just hid behind a way you will die and that can ♥♥♥♥ off so thats a minus but for the most part its good.
7.5/10

Multiplayer - Surprisingly this game still has community playing the multiplayer and they have a damn right to play it because this multiplayer is really really REALLY COOL because you can trigger BULLETIME in a multiplayer session
and that is glorious. I have not experienced any lag issues or problems playing multiplayer (and i even have crappy internet) and i think its enjoyable. 10/10

my final verdict on this game is 93/100 because this game is truly at its finest
hoursPlayed: buy it now! :D"

reviewText: The story, game mechanics, port quality, voice acting, animations, and pretty much everything about this game are both amazing and extremely polished. I was able to run it at 1080p constant 60 FPS (with maybe 1-2 slowdowns during the favela missions) so the port was definitely one of Rockstar's best. The story is about 9-10 hours long depending on your play-style but each level is incredibly detailed and diverse. Finally, as generic as it might sound, the graphics are absolutely gorgeous and stunning. I would definitely recommend this game to any gamer.

reviewText: I've played 85 hours.  Very replayable game -- on same difficulty, or on the next-higher.\n\nIt's got a great story, and excellent character development.  It's an over-the-shoulder camera, not FPS, but this actually works out better for the game.   It's a story, but many levels are quite open-world-feeling.  Shoot-out tactics are needed to succeed, and the level-maps offer plenty of diversity.  In some other levels, you're in a rush to chase someone down, so there is a lot of variety in the gameplay.  Last, the story has lots of great twists, which is rare for a game in this genre.

If you go into the game expecting a cinematic experience with a deep story mixed with addicting and fast paced gameplay, you will be thoroughly entertained.

Bottom Line: buy this game.

reviewText:
Max Payne 3 at its heart is a blisteringly entertaining run-and-gun style third-person shooter.

Payne's brutal, hyper-stylised combat gameplay mode is fast and full of action.. The game takes you through a very cinematic and comic style-based experience with cut scenes during the loading  between chapters and it features a rock-solid storyline.

Manoeuvering within the environment is super slick. At the core are bullet time & shoot-dodge mechanism. Inside there is a state of the art aim & cover system which essentially allows you to go into slow-motion bullet-mode.

It has a diverse selection of multiplayer modes, combining team & solo-based match types such as:

- Deathmatch
- Team Deathmatch
- Large Team Deathmatch
- Dead Man Walking (survival mode)
- Gang Wars (slightly story mode-based multi-stage team-based face-off)


The only downfall to this game's multi-player mode is..

It can be loaded witch cheaters every now and then"

As you're getting better over time this cheater issue become less of a real problem anyway!!



I think Max Payne 3 is one of the coolest third-person shooters out there!


CHEERS"
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This game is about 'Mad' Max Rockatansky, a former Bronzer from Nu York who travels to the third world to work as a bodyguard for some rich ♥♥♥♥nuggets. But trouble follows Max from the wasteland as his employers wife is captured by Lord Humungus and Max must delve deep into the underbelly of Brazil to save them. This game does a great job of creating a believable life in post-apocalyptic Nu York (which looks like an absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥) and the gang-ravaged deadzone of Brazil (which coincedentally, looks like an absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥). This is the sequel Beyond Thunderdome should have been, although I was disappointed by Mel Gibson taking on an American accent this time and they didn't use his likeness either which was ♥♥♥♥.

reviewText:
Hey guy's Roley4498 here with my single player review, Max Payne 3 ( no spoilers )

Introduction : Well guys from the off this game is slick, real effort has been made to make this game ooze A grade quality. The little thing's like when the character's talk and certain words pop up on the screen like a hidden message, through to the quit game option when you're propersitioned with a moral choice, this game is about as cool as it get's.

Story : Dark, moody and gritty to sum up, not gonna reveal too much (or anything really) but this is typical Max Payne's ' it's all gone wrong '. The story is told with great narritive and cinematic's. 10/10

Graphics : In a word, stunning, really is like playing a movie and right up there with The Witcher 2 and in some way's surpasses, the level of detail is fantastic, from the characters themselves to the animation's, everything is stylish and well polished. Set piece gun fights take place in a varity of well detailed areas from nightclubs to rooftops to stadiums and many more.  10/10

Sound : Perfectly implemented music that really add's to the atomsphere, from the slow build up's to the gunfights to the pumping beats as you lay waste to many. The voice acting is second to none as i said it's like watching a movie, whether its verbal assualt from the enemy or the dark dry humour of Max the sound and voice acting are brilliant throughout. 10/10

Gameplay : This is where the game really shine's, the euphoria physics engine used is astoundingly realistic, where ever the enemy is shot, what weapon is used and what action the enemy is performing will give different results when he dies. then there's the bullet time, giving maximum brutality kills, the game is ultra violent, i slow timed my bullet into the enemies face and watched his jaw come off, i then fired a further 3-4 shots ( still in slow motion ) and watched him lose the rest of his face, never seen anything like this in a game.

Max Payne 3 uses the good old hide and use cover system too for stealth but be aware the enemy ain't so stupid and will attempt to flank you as soon as possible to add to the mayhem, and failing that then it's grenades inbound !! Every gun fight is a pleasure to fight through and you'll be wanting more and more in which case this game delivers time and time again. the game also has hidden gun parts to collect to keep you exploring and lots to interact with within the game ( TV's , pianos and evidence) not to mention the achievments for number of arm shots, leg shots through to time in bullet mod. 10/10

Conclusion : As single player action games go, this is top of them all and lenghty too with plenty of replay value ( weapon parts to collect and harder difficulty modes ) i highly recommend this game to everyone ( 18 and above ) as this is a masterpiece, not just a game but an experiance.  10/10

Final notes : Yes i played on max settings ( GTX 680 SLI ) but be aware the graphic's didn't make this game the gameplay did.  :D

reviewText:
Max Payne is indeed one of the best games I have played. With it's fascinating story and gameplay, you get the feeling like being right inside the game. Rockstar brings an excellent, epic story, that I have enjoyed from the beginning till the end. I do not want to spoil everything from the game to you, so I advice you to buy the game and try yourself.

The multiplayer in the game is also playable and quite fun, but after a while it felt boring, at least for me.

Alltogether, with it's fantastic story, gameplay, graphics, sounds and physics this game is true masterpiece, a must have for every third-person action shooter lover.

9.5/10
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: It's been over a year since the release of Max Payne 3 and I decided to replay the game once again and share a few of my insights. First off, I can definitely say I'd recommend this game, since it carries the very essence of the previous parts of the franchise. The RAGE engine looks gorgeous and making headshots in bullet time is as fun as ever. The game runs pretty darn well on most systems. The storytelling is great and Max's monologues reveal the self-pity he's fighting after the loss of his family. What I did not like is the amount of cutscenes which interupt the fun you're having over and over again. Of course, those who intend to run through the game just once - will find the cutscenes to be a great addition. On the other hand, those, who are planning to complete the game on different difficulty levels, or just hunt for achievements, are bound to watch the unskippable cutscenes. The soundtrack adds up to the memorable shooting sequences and provides a few classy tracks which may find their way into your MP3 player. Conclusion: go get this game, it's worth it! 9/10

reviewText: This is truly a fantastic game. Max Payne 3 is a great shooter with an extremely fascinating script and storyline that totally succeeds in delivering a perfect noir tale! The pacing is just the right speed and I personally had no trouble playing this game nonstop for more than a couple of hours. The graphics, full of detail and constantly very colorful and at times and very beautiful as well. The characters, brimming with interesting personality traits all while delivering quick, intriguing, and sometimes very funny lines. The action and gameplay, a huge amount of fun that never grows tiring and always works well and correctly. And Max Payne himself, as engaging and engrossing a character as ever while also being voiced wonderfully by James McCaffrey. Great game by R*.

reviewText:
Rockstar finally got around to creating advanced PC graphics for one of their games. It looks like they learned something after GTA 4 after all.

This time we get DX 11 tesselation, ambient occlusion (advanced sun rays), FXAA, MSAA, Anisotropic filtering as well as texture, shader, shadow, reflection and water quality tweaks. Needless to say this game has some heavy PC requirements. I was able to get 30 FPS with my powerful rig, but as soon as I turned down the multisampling anti-aliasing from 8x to 4x I got around 50-60 FPS throughout the rest of the game. Some jumpy shadows and halo around certain objects were also fixed. There are much more sharp edges and corners to be seen now. There will be certain areas in the game where you will see objects just appearing out of thing air.

Here are some other things that I have noticed. When you die at a checkpoint and you start over, you get to play with your full health even though you're supposed to be wounded. No more manual saves for us PC gamers. So you can thank Rockstar for when you get stuck in am awful area where you die over and over again. I also haven't noticed the first time around that you can actually go prone in this game. Sometimes its helpful but it takes you a long time to lie down and get up, so you will feel pretty exposed.

Remedy sold its soul and now its turning in its grave. Oh wait, they are still around! I wonder how they feel after letting Take-Two/Rockstar make the third installment. I mean what were they thinking? ok so Max crosses some people back home (finally); then get recruited by an old police academy buddy to go work in Brazil. How exciting. I also like how you protect the girl because Max Payne doesn't like seeing girls get hit; moments later you can actually shoot the girl with no consequences. This thing has GTA written all over it.

I really wonder whose bright idea at Rockstar it was to make Max Payne bald and place him in Brazil. When I first saw the screenshots back a couple of years ago I actually, in all honesty, thought it was a joke. I thought that Rockstar was just fooling around with some pre-production ideas.

Let's start off with a little history lesson.

The first game introduced the bullet time feature. This feature revolutionized third person shooters. Since then, many games copied the mechanics. Dead to Rights, F.E.A.R., Call of Juarez, Strangehold, Red Dead Redemption, Sniper Elite, Vanquish, Wanted. What started off as a style mechanic slowly evolved into assist mechanic, aim assist that is. The first and second games did not rely on protracted gun fights with cover; it was mostly about short encounters with a handful of enemies, so the gun fights were all about your reflexes. (more on that later).

Imagine a heavily scripted and narrative-driven GTA 4 plus a little bit of Red Dead Redemption touch. Congrats, you have just imagined Max Payne 3 (minus car theft). Same engine was used in GTA 4 and RDR.

Gone is the dark NY noire. Gone are the days when Max Payne 1,2 came out on PC FIRST and was rated higher than the console counter-parts. Gone are the characters from the first two games. Gone is the isolation that you felt in the first two games (now you will have back up nearby quite often). Gone are the derelict New York city alleys, gone is the comic-book narrative. In fact, the feeling you got from playing the first two games was that there WAS no world outside of New York at all. Here you get about 40 minutes of gameplay in New Jersey with the old Payne Jacket, the snow falling and the mobsters shooting you, (flashback to the good old days), but that's as close to NY as you will get in the game. I mean why couldn't they continue with the NY/NJ timeline? The mafia boss could be the villain and Max could easily continue running around NY and NJ. Ironically, the two flashbacks were the best parts of the game for me.

Now it is time to make way for the dance clubs, mini-skirts, Hawaiian shirts, the ability to kill friendly NPCs with no consequences, the annoying unremarkable uninteresting characters (Rockstar has a hard-on for those); make way for the side kicks, crazy blinding lights (people with epilepsy, BEWARE), the rural slums, sunny outdoors, frequent cut scenes that can't be skipped because the game is loading the new level (there are no loading screens here btw), Portuguese speaking enemies (no English subtitles by the way), the lack of suspense, and don't forget the multiplayer....yeah, the Max Payne franchise desperately needed that one.

And don't even get me started on the cut scenes, there are so many of them. The interrupt the fire fight continuity and decrease the urge to replay the game with guns blazing. The cut scenes also place you in scripted locations even though you were taking cover a second ago. At times, there is a cut scene every 1.5 minutes. Half the time you cannot skip them because that is when the game is apparently still loading. Every, and I repeat, EVERY cut scene is messed up. What I mean by that is that every cut scene has effects" added to it. These include: blurry/static screen
hoursPlayed: sepia hue

reviewText:
This is a review about the Rockstar Social Club and how it´s (not) working with Steam.

The game itself is very well made and I enjoyed it alot.
It´s like playing a movie.

The Rockstar social club sadly screws the whole experience completley.

I recently reinstalled my computer and I can´t play Max Payne 3 anymore.
You are FORCED to log into your Rockstar Social Club account in order to play this game, but after reinstalling the game it  doesn´t work anymore.

You can´t even make a new account, changing the password wont help, in fact nothing will help.

The game is just unplayable like this.
Not because of bugs but because you simply can´t even start it.

Wouldn´t recommend this game to anyone that wants to play it more than just once and is probably reinstalling the computer in between.

It´s actually sad that such a big company can´t fix a problem like this.
Please don´t sell games on Steam if they won´t work properly with Steam.

//
Sorry if I mispelled some words or stumbled across the tenses, not a native speaker and stuff.

reviewText: The game needs more game... There are way too many cutscenes, every time you touch a door...it's a cinematic... but that is not even the bigest problem, after the cinematic is done, you are back holding you handhund, and not even dual wield...but just single pistol...even tho you might be holding an AK orwhatever else in the other hand...This becomes really anoying after a while. reviewText:
Pros:
Fantastic story and narrative. Good cinematics. Bullet time (player activated slow-mo) is fun. Good music and mostly nice environments.

Cons:
This game becomes tiring. At the START of the game you could kill enemies by one shot in the head. Later on some enemies need 5+ shots in the head to finally die, when they are wearing nothing on the head, or just a basebul cap. It takes the fun out of things when you don't know after how many shots to the head will kill the enemy. This ruins bullet time too. Massively disappointing if you start the game on the hardest difficulty and progress.

Bullet time was more fun in previous max payne games. Bullet time adds fun, so why reduce the amount of time you can bullet time? There was clearly more of it in previous games.

The engine this game was built on just is not fluid enough. The RAGE engine is not even remotely as good as some modern engines. It's great for GTA, but a FPS? Compare this to the Source engine, Unreal engine, Frostbite engine.... It's just kind of poor in comparison. Less fluid, more bugs, more glitches, worse AI, bulky. Lacking optimization.
You can just look at the game size to see how bulky it is. 33gb +? Really? The graphics and cinematics arn't that great. This game could be compressed down to 10gb. We all see what you are trying to do here Rockstar...

No tactics (again due to the engine and AI).
Point and shoot. Use bullet time. Repeat. Point and shoot use bullet time. repeat. Endless chases with the enemy escaping in the last second.

The story is WAY too slow. If it were 70% faster and the game 70% shorter, it would be a lot better. It feels like a constant chore to continue. This is a prime example of a producer over prolonging a story to justify a higher price tag.

oh... and F**k off Social club. Signups/Signings and additional bloatware installations and DRM suck.

Lots of bugs and graphical glitches are present.

PS. I recently shot an enemy without a helmet 8 times, point blank, with a .38 revolver before he finally died. Bull***t

PSS. Max Payne 3 has stopped working. This happens a lot on windows 10.

PSSS. After 9 hours I finally had enough, uninstalled and watched the ending on youtube. Changed review to negative.

Get this game if you like story driven games with lots of cinematics and if you liked the previous Max Paynes. Otherwise AVOID!

reviewText:
Max Payne. For any gamer who knows their salt, this name should be familiar. His publisher Take Two has released two games in 2001 and 2003 to great reviews and a decent amount of critical acclaim. Since then, though, the ex-cop has been left in the dust, barely being remembered other than that crappy movie that was released around then with Mark Wahlberg. It seemed for a while Max would just fade away, until back in 2012, when Rockstar Games, now owners of Take Two, released Max Payne 3. How was that? Well, we're taking a look at it now.

STORY: You're... Max Payne, of course. After the events of the last two games, Max is a drunken mess, he smokes regularly, he's addicted to painkillers, and he tries to find a reason to not blow his head off daily. Up until one day, when his old friend Passos comes across him and hires him to guard a wealthy family in Sao Paulo, Brazil named the Bronco's. Everything seems fine until the wife of the eldest Bronco is kidnapped, and Max and Passos go on a search to find her. That's all I can really say about it without spoilering it. It's a pretty well put together story. It can be pretty depressing at times when you see Max lose, but when he wins, which is kind of rare, it feels great. That's really all you can ask for. The story is a bit on the short side, took me 10 hours to beat it on Medium, but it's a good experience regardless.

GAMEPLAY: 3rd person shooter. You have 4 slots for guns. You have 2 slots one handed weapons, another for a two handed weapon, and the 4th one is dual wielding the two one handed weapons you have on you. All methods are satisfying enough, and gunplay is fantastic. The innovative Bullet Time from the last few games is here too, and that is great, and it has some new features. If you carry painkillers on you, and you lose all your health, you have a chance to shoot the guy who would have killed you and take him out, getting some health back and putting you back into the fight. Ammo can be a bit scarce, especially on the harder difficulties, but if you're efficient enough, you can do well. The game is freaking hard, btw, even when I played it on Medium, it was hard. The game is really satisfying when you beat the levels, and I ended up replaying it on Hardcore, which made me tear my hair out a bit but it was totally worth it. Gameplay is fantastic, maybe even best of 2012.

GRAPHICS AND PERFORMANCE: Game looks good. The favelas of Sao Paulo look grimy and dirty, the nicer penthouses are well designed. There are a lot of nice details in all the levels without a doubt. This isn't a grand open world game like GTA or Red Dead Redemption or LA Noire like Rockstar is known for making, but the smaller levels are fine. They all look great. Game runs pretty well as well, since it's a game from 2012, if you have any recent hardware you should be fine. Runs well enough on my PC, and if I can run it, you can run it.

CHARACTERS AND VOICE ACTING: Max Payne has his voice actor from the last games, James McCaffery, and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, is he as good as ever. The other characters are voiced well enough too. The characters look good, Max goes through a bit of a redesign halfway through which some people didn't like, but I thought he looked fine. Overall it's fine.

MULTIPLAYER: Practically abandoned on PC, played a bit on my 360, kind of fun, but nothing spectacular, odds are unless you get a big community for it you wont get to play it anyway.

EXTRAS: In each level, there are clues that relate to the story, though you have to look for a few of them. There are also some parts for golden versions of each weapon, and if you get all the parts scattered around the levels, you get a better version of the gun every time you pick it up. Once you beat the game, you unlock Score Attack, which is basically a kill and get points mode. There's also the New York Minute mode, where you have to beat a level in a minute. Well, you get time for killing guys, but still. If you arent impressed by that, then you have New Youk Minute Hardcore mode, in which you have to beat the whole game in a minute with the same bonuses, with no deaths. Yeah... good luck with that.

FINAL VERDICT: Phenominal game. One of the best of 2012, strong competator with Far Cry 3 and Mass Effect 3 for that slot. 9/10, it's worth picking up around a sale, hell, even right now. Try it out sometime, it will not disappoint.

reviewText:
Yes I am late to the party on this one, but I will still recommend it. Especially to any Max Payne fans.

I personally liked the first game in the series the most. Had the best/most intriguing atmosphere/story not to mention really impressive gunplay. (especially for its time) That being said I will say that I think Max Payne 3 is number two on that list. With Max Payne 2 coming in last. Though I enjoyed them all.

The second Max Payne tends to lose you right around the last 1/3 of the game. The first, and third games in the series do not suffer from that, and have great pacing all around.

Now to focus more on this game. It has great graphics, gameplay, gunplay, and the difficulty spikes can be a pain, but are not too bad. I personally like the melee on this game the best out of the 3 games. weapon selection is always pretty good in these games, but grenades are so scare I don't even think I got to use one. I remember in MP1, and MP2, you could get grenades, and definitely get molotov cocktails. They are not so present in this game from the players perspective.

Its not a short game, but its also not as long as people claim it is, I beat it on hard in about 12 hours, not counting setup and AFKs.

It is very movie like, the way it transitions back and forth is pretty well done. Especially for a game that came out 3 years ago.

I did like the reflections back in this game, and the snow levels (which is why I loved New York in the first game) That being said they used the atmosphere of this game to create a completely different feeling Max Payne, and they did a pretty good job of it. The music really accented what was happening in the game at the time, as well as, stands out as pretty good tracks overall. The music has always been pretty good in Max Payne, but the third one has the best music of the series.

The story/plot of this one didn't have as much impact on me as the first game, and a lot of it was cliche', but it turned out to be pretty decent.  The voice acting was good, and most of the sound effects were ok, but could have been better. The performance of hte game is pretty straight forward especially if you don't go crazy with MSAA. I do like that the gameplay reflects his age, and how worn he is. He is not near as fast as in the first 2 games. He takes at least twice as long to recover from a dive in this game. Much more of a cinematic experience than the first two games, but they molded the new with the old fairly well.

The multiplayer has been shut down by now, but the game is still worth purchasing. It also is one of the many games on steam that always sees a decent %off on ever Steam sale.

reviewText:
Let me start by saying I am a huge fan of the Max Payne franchise. It has been a
phenominal story driven noir experiance that is unmatched in gaming to this day.

I was apprehensive to say the least when I heard that Remedy lost the rights
to the Max Payne name to Rockstart studios. When I heard the game would be
set in Brazil I was even more apprehensive. How can you have a Max Payne set
not in the iconic New York city. I was afraid they would trash the franchise and
turn it into a new money grubbing copypasta game series that forgets what it
was all about.

To be fair, the game blew away my expectations. In every aspect the game is
solid and quality. The graphics, story, pacing, gameplay and voice acting are
top notch. Worthy of a Max Payne game. First the good.

The game itself is incredibly well put together. The story is tight but the weak
est entry in the series. However it is quite enjoyable hearing Max chew through
his lines and wit as sharp as ever. The graphics are using the RAGE engine and
it is truly stunning. The physics are the best on the market. I do miss the story
board way of telling a story. It is sorely missed in Max Payne 3. The new age"
way of doing the story convence is okay but it can be a little annoying. People
complain that there are too many cinematics in MP3
date:
but its a story driven game
and so I think it makes sense. I enjoy seeing the beauty of the game unfold with
excellent voice acting and animations. It all comes together incredibly well.

The gameplay and particularly the gunplay is BY FAR the BEST part of this
game. It is the BEST 3rd person shooter ever made. The combat is a true
pleasure. The bullets showing where you hit enemies
hoursPlayed:
how their bodies react. Its an incredible ballad of death.

I don't think I really have to write much more. Simply put Max Payne 3 is the
best 3rd person shooter I have ever played. It is also a damn fine entry in an
incredibly franchise. I honestly hope Rockstar is not done with Max Payne.
Seeing as 3 was as solid as it was. Max Payne 3 from a die hard fan is a must
buy.

9/10 A MUST BUY."

reviewText: Remedy did a fantastic job with Max Payne 1 & 2  and Rockstar  took it to whole new level . Action sequences are  amazing just like the previous games and max is best when it comes to killing people . The animation and physics is phenomenal , the way goons react when shot looks great . This game is heavy on violence and gore . Max 's animation are life like with new  moves like rolling while lying on the ground and cover syatem . It all looks so natural . Rockstar do know how to tell stories and max payne 3 is no exception . In the end it feels like its been dragged but overall great story . Shooting is solid and it is fun to craft headshots in bullet time and shootdoge , so EPIC .  Music and visuals are good . Max payne is best video game character ever imo , and he is even more compelling in max payne 3 . James McCaffrey's voice acting is rock solid and max's one liners are boss . One of the negative aspects is custscene , cutscenes sometimes break the flow of the game . There are many unnecessary cutscenes to mask loading times which really drops the mood . If previous games were 9.9 then this game is 9.5 , nothing less . reviewText:
One of the best games I've ever played. Rockstar blew my mind again with the 3rd chapter of Max's history. The pain killers and booze have numbed him but didn't cure the wounds. He's become what his loved one's killers wanted him to be - a killer -  and he shows up more disturbed and reckless than ever, as he tries to not slack on another job and get out of it alive.

Max's dark and sarcastic monologues voiced by actor James McCaffrey are pure gold and come mixed with an excelent soundtrack and effects.

Running on RAGE (Rockstar Advanced Game Engine, the same graphic engine that powers GTA IV and V) and Euphoria physics, the game couples beautiful and highly detailed graphics with smooth,fluid gameplay. Features like Bullet Time and the ultra smart and diverse enemy AI are icing on top of the cake.

The cinematics and intensely chaotic gun fights add up to the immersion and the online multiplayer has various modes to choose from where you can play and customize with various weapon/gear/skill loadouts many characters from the story mode.

A must have for fans of the series or the genre.

reviewText:
Max Payne 3 confuses me. On the one hand it retains 'the shoot first ask questions later' feel of old school fps games, marries them with some ridiculous (but admittedly cool) set pieces and together manages to produce an extremely fun bullet riddled campaign of destructive justice. Pretty much what defines Max Payne to be honest. It true Rockstar fashion, the cinematic presentation is excellent, as is the score.

On the other hand, the game suffers from some terrible design ideas like last stand (basically leaves you a sitting duck on the floor being shot at from multiple directions), clunky controls, incredibly cramped environments, over reliance on closet mobs that literally spawn out of thin air, annoying monologue by Max about everything.. (and I mean EVERYTHING) and some of the worst follow NPC's in recent history. The story isn't particularly well written, characterization is average at best and the (thankfully) few 'boss' encounters are average at best; frustrating at worst.

So why would I recommend this game then? Because it is FUN. Also, explosions everywhere. Really, for $5, it's totally worth it.

P.S. You are going to have to deal with Rockstar Social Club so prepare yourself.

reviewText:
The game forces you to register @Rockstars Social Club before allowing you to do anyting at all.
Want to change the volume? resolution? input? Nah mate, register at Rockstars SC first!

Now you want to register and it just does not work, at least in my case. It gave me an error that my password had to be Xletters and contain this and that - even though it did.
So lets ask google, after around 5 minutes I found an article somewhere that stated you also need to have a case-sensitive letter in your password.
So lets try that... and voila, my account got created.

At this point, we are at around 15 minutes just to create my RSC account, just because the error windows does not state that you also need a case sensetive letter in your password, even though you do.


Allright, finaly able to change the game settings, so lets start with the graphic.
Change textures to high from medium.. game needs to restart & reload, which takes ages and it needs to do that for every, single, thing you change, always.
Well, 2-3 restarts later, somewhat ok'ish FPS...

now we are at good 40min and I havent even played the game for a single second yet.

So lets try multiplayer ... cant connect... error... bla bla.. OKAY, lets google again.....
turns out to be able to play this game online you need to do alot of things that seem to vary from user to user, however after again 5min googling, it should be something around: disable your firewall and/or open up to 13, yes: thirteen. ports in your router.

Now we are at almost an hour just trying to set up this darned game and still would have to deal with portforwarding for multiplayer, I'm done.
->at least steam took the game back w/o any hassle and refunded me.

Do not buy this, ever. The SP seems to be good, as I've seen quite a lot of gameplay from it but it is just not worth all the hassle it comes with. Not even for 5 or less €.

reviewText:
Simply an absolutely brilliantly fantastic game. I'm playing the story again I enjoyed it so much. The detail that has been put into this game is breath taking, the levels do not appear lifeless and empty as in many games. Shoot dodge I love and I have developed a tendency to just use it whenever because it is so cool. As I said at the beginning, is excellent. I don’t know about other people but I was working out how elements fit together just as Max was, which in my opinion is a testament to how well thought out the game is.

Basically stop reading, start playing.

reviewText:
If you loved any of the 2 previous Max Payne games, then GET THIS ONE TOOOOOOOO!! Don't worry if you didn't play any of the previous titles though as this game doesn't have anything to do with the previous storyline.

Pros:
+Bullet time is absolutely brutal this time around.
+Graphics are gorgeous! My eyes melted away as I saw both the beautiful and ghetto side of Brazil.
+The music. Good God if my ears could j*zz they would!
+Story is very gripping but isn't too deep (it's basically a Die Hard plotline)
+Controls are very fluid and responsive (though the covering mechanism bugged out on me a couple of times and Max just refused to take cover no matter how fast I pressed that button)
+Multiplayer is better than COD (honestly....anything is better than COD......except Duke Nukem Forever....). Rockstar managed to keep Bullet Time in multiplayer so laugh as you slow-mo kill someone who jumped for cover!
+Replayablilty is finally in a Max Payne game! (Collecting Golden guns, clues, and grinds! Did I mention Multiplayer?)

Cons:
-Buggy covering mechanism (probably just me tho...)
-Enemies are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Seriously some of them just run right at you.....with a pistol. Really guys?
-For some reason Rockstar decided to add fuzz/flare in the game. It happens in EVERY. F*CKING. CUTSCENE. I took more pills than Max to get rid of my raging headache.
-Multiplayer lobbies are sometimes empty. Yeah sorry guys, not a lot of people play this game online. On the plus side you can invite your friends to a deathmatch AND rank up that way! So go have fun hatin' each other!

Overall: Yew liek teh shooting? Good, this game rewards you for every headshot you make. Watch as the bullet literally comes out the other side of your enemies head in glorious slow-mo! I give this game 8 pills out of 10! Play it if you're looking for a different kind of shoot 'em up.

reviewText:
I liked the story but the gameplay was a complete Cluster f*uck. I found myself running head on into situations that were impossible to overcome and the controls felt like they were designed for a gamepad over a mouse and keyboard. The mechanics behind game were solid, bullet time was useful at times but the AI were just Batsh*t crazy. I found it hard to hang back and plink them off one by one with them suicidally sprinting at me and constantly throwing grenades and it made the game feel too fast paced and random over, being speedy and action packed how I prefer. One thing I found most unsettling is with me constantly dying the game decided to crash a lot which DESTROYED the flow of the game and its play ability. All in All I will keep the game installed and try to play it, but the game still needs some TLC, especially with the AI and crashing after the 3rd death. This game is not perfect for me, but great for people who use a gamepad and love a good fast-pace shooter!


If you found this review useful please comment and let me know as this is my first and I may do more.

reviewText:
So I really enjoyed this.
The level variety's pretty mint, and the gunplay's very satisfying. One of the few games where it’s fun to play right to the end, and not just becoming a grind to finish the story.

However, Social Club is detrimental, and doesn’t allow me access to multiplayer or the store because I live in New Zealand, so I couldn’t activate any of the DLC.

Also, Max Payne is one of the most negative anti-heroes I’ve ever played as. The most positive thing he says is “I’m getting good at this” as he pushes a button on a wall.

Also the game expects you to look for collectables while also having Max drop hints like “I decided to stop faffing around in the restroom and went outside to kill more people”, whereupon you find more pills in the toilet bowl.
But Max’s comments are sometimes different when you die and replay a bit, so that was a nice touch.

So yeah. Tis good. If you’re cool rocking the lead role in an interactive action movie WITH NO QUICK TIME EVENTS <3 <3 <3, this is for you.

reviewText:
Max Payne 3 (even though the series as a whole as well) is golden action game material.

If you like to shoot mobsters, get this game.
If you like amazing story and dialogue, get this game.
If you like amazing shooting mechanics and realistic character animations, get this game.

for 13 years I have been a huge Max Payne fan, and I have been amazed with the games since childhood.
It never gets old.  Ive beaten Max Payne 3 multiple times on console, and 1 and 1/2 times on pc (currently playing on hard).
Collecting all the evidence and golden guns to replay the game thugged out with golden weapons adds plenty of replayability.  And the gameplay is so great that it doesn't wear out its welcome.

Buy this game.  Buy all of them.  Payne to the max.

10/10

reviewText: I finally got around to revisiting the Max Payne series after playing the original around 2002.  You can see my review for Max Payne 2 elsewhere (tldr: same gameplay, loses great storytelling and themes, do not recommend).  Unlike the first sequel, this one delivers.\n\nThis game features modern graphics, a vibrant setting (predominately Sao Paulo, Brazil), and a return to the bullet time" gameplay wherein the player can slow down time to make cinematic diving shots.  There is the addition of cover in this game
date: and my main criticism is that it relies on it a little too much.\n\nWhile the story does not have the deeper thematic undertones like the original's Norse mythology
recommended: it is still an interesting noir detective offering often juxtaposed in sunny South American settings.  It is well worth at least one playthrough.  I recommend just enjoying the story and increased bullet time of the easier setting."

reviewText:
Woah, what an... experience this bugger was.
Max Payne 3 is less like a game and more like a movie in which you get to shoot bad guys and choose guns to an extent.
While having a Story that will or wont get you hooked, depending on your willingness to immerse with the new Max Payne character, the game falls of a bit uncreative in gameplay. The leveldesign is absolutely fantastic, showing different environments and variety within them, but mostly, the player will walk from A to B while triggering actionbubbles of bad guys to fight, more often than not with short cutscenes inbetween. This can be seen as a red string adventure with fluent interaction, but whoever wants to simply play ye good ole shooter and be able to traverse freely within sections of a level will be quite disappointed with this game.
In fact, altough I really enjoyed the game, especially the tale that it told, and I was hooked by it from the start, I will refrain from touching it again, because beyond the first run through the story, I probably wont be able to get much more out of the game. It's just too repetitive and boring after you've seen the environment once or twice, twice being the time you died because the game picked a weapon that was empty for you during a scripted snippet. Like, wow, you could've just told me to go ♥♥♥♥ myself.
TL;DR: Graphically stunning, but in gameplay falls short. Great story, but like a movie, play only again if you might want to go check on details or just generally enjoyed the plot.
8/10 would loose wife and child to become ultimate sad terrorist cop ever again.

reviewText:
First of all, this game is just gorgeous. On max settings it has to be one of the best looking games I have ever seen. As well as the graphics, Rockstar should be praised on the amount of detail this game has (though that shouldn't be a surprise). The game seems to be optimised very well, also. It runs very smoothly and is one of the more pleasant
PC gaming experiences I have had.

Having never previously played any previous instalments in the Max Payne franchise, I picked up Max Payne 3 not knowing what to expect, but I do have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed the single player campaign, and I do believe the game is worth its full retail price. If you can pick it up during a sale, then you're laughing. The gun controls in Grand Theft Auto IV are very sticky, but they have been fixed here, so no need to worry. Although it does have partial controller support, I would just use the mouse and keyboard as this title is not an open world game.

As for the multiplayer, well, it's not my thing, but I have played a little bit of it and I do appreciate it. Bullet Time does actually work well, too.

reviewText:
It's not quite Max Payne 1 and 2 but it's definitely a great game on its own merit.

The voice and character of Max returns but the writing and dialogue isn't quite as clever and creative and sadly the graphic novel style intermissions between acts do not make a comeback. Add to this a distinct lack of a dark, snow-blasted New York City and the game fails to deliver the Noire-esque experience fans of the series had come to expect.

What the game lacks however it makes up for in visceral, unforgiving gunplay and raw style. It has great visuals and a kick-♥♥♥ soundtrack to boot.

Definitely worth playing through at least once or twice.

reviewText:
I liked the story but the gameplay was a complete Cluster f*uck. I found myself running head on into situations that were impossible to overcome and the controls felt like they were designed for a gamepad over a mouse and keyboard. The mechanics behind game were solid, bullet time was useful at times but the AI were just Batsh*t crazy. I found it hard to hang back and plink them off one by one with them suicidally sprinting at me and constantly throwing grenades and it made the game feel too fast paced and random over, being speedy and action packed how I prefer. One thing I found most unsettling is with me constantly dying the game decided to crash a lot which DESTROYED the flow of the game and its play ability. All in All I will keep the game installed and try to play it, but the game still needs some TLC, especially with the AI and crashing after the 3rd death. This game is not perfect for me, but great for people who use a gamepad and love a good fast-pace shooter!

reviewText:
So I really enjoyed this.
The level variety's pretty mint, and the gunplay's very satisfying. One of the few games where it’s fun to play right to the end, and not just becoming a grind to finish the story.

However, Social Club is detrimental, and doesn’t allow me access to multiplayer or the store because I live in New Zealand, so I couldn’t activate any of the DLC.

Also, Max Payne is one of the most negative anti-heroes I’ve ever played as. The most positive thing he says is “I’m getting good at this” as he pushes a button on a wall.

Also the game expects you to look for collectables while also having Max drop hints like “I decided to stop faffing around in the restroom and went outside to kill more people”, whereupon you find more pills in the toilet bowl.
But Max’s comments are sometimes different when you die and replay a bit, so that was a nice touch.

So yeah. Tis good. If you’re cool rocking the lead role in an interactive action movie WITH NO QUICK TIME EVENTS <3 <3 <3, this is for you.

reviewText:
A pretty solid shooter with a good amount of variety, though I do I have a few gripes about it.

Excellent narrative; everything Max says throughout the game is spot on, and there's no shortage of it.

That said, the gameplay is pretty much entirely based around using your bullet-time to get headshots, so keep that in mind as you play it. Any shots that are not in the head feel like you're just wasting bullets.

I'm not a fan of the checkpoint system and really miss any sort of quicksave and quickload options. It makes it significantly harder to optimize your play.

The control also feels a lot looser" than previous Max Payne games. I'm sure this is played up as Max being older and far less agile
date: but it can still feel a bit frustrating just the same.\n\nOverall
recommended: it's certainly worth getting if only to hear Max's thoughts on this newest human cesspool of crime."

reviewText:
Max Payne 3 is a decent shooting game that is hard to find these days: great cover mechanics, slow-mo and of course, lots of pain killers. Story wise, it does tell an interesting enough story to keep you engaged throughout the game with a bit of politics, the rich here, the poor there, etc. That said, it is nowhere near its predecessors; almost everything I love was taken away: The noire atmosphere, the stylist comic-like mission intros, the nightmares, hallucination, the rainy, pissy NYC nights...

The multiplayer mode - frankly, I don't care much about it - is okay; it has a level-up system with cool perks, character/weapon customization and a few modes for you to practice slo-mo shooting - yeah, slo-mo shooting in multiplayer mode. Still, I couldn't get into it; guess I suck that much.

Please don't give up your hope just yet, like I mentioned earlier, Max Payne 3, in the end, is still a very good shooter. Just try and you'll see for yourself.

reviewText:
Max Payne is back, and what a ride it is!
The story-telling is sick and masterly crafted, beginning with a gripping intro and never really letting go at all. Gameplay is tight and bullet-time feels completely right and the dodge-jumping is just as useless as it was in the first 2 games.

Can recommend wholeheartedly.

Some gripes:
Can leave you fatigued, too many cut-scenes and the constant screen effects can and will be a bit too much by the end of the game.

No way of skipping cut-scenes, even if you’ve seen them, might be a bug but it always says loading" for me
date: would rather see a loading screen than wait for it to load in the background.\n\nThe story is less personal

reviewText:
Simply an absolutely brilliantly fantastic game. I'm playing the story again I enjoyed it so much. The detail that has been put into this game is breath taking, the levels do not appear lifeless and empty as in many games.
