Shoot dodge I love and I have developed a tendency to just use it whenever because it is so cool. As I said at the beginning, is excellent. I don’t know about other people but I was working out how elements fit together just as Max was, which in my opinion is a testament to how well thought out the game is.

Basically stop reading, start playing.

reviewText:
Every Max Payne achieved the same thing - Press forward a noir story sugar coated in bullet-time funsies.
It's nice to be able to say that Rockstar have done a great job on all three games of the franchise. It never strays from its true roots, so fans of the style and gameplay have always been presented with a new and improved version of a game they loved from before.

Max Payne 3 is more of the same - Being far superior to ME2 in terms of story, looks, style and combat - Just like ME2 was to ME1. If you were ever a fan of Max Payne, MP3 is worth the purchase just to get that fresh and more recent slice of fun, even if it shakes up the locations and style but doesn't really stray from what made the game Max Payne in the first place... This is also the negative side for 'some' who may have wanted something different - But maybe those few will be swayed by the fact MP3 has multiplayer - And a multiplayer that actually works very well. The only issue you can have with it is population of regular players, though despite me being very late to the MP3 party, I still managed to experience some fun MP games packed with people.

As for the campaign - Max is older, much like the game itself - And you will feel it. Bumping against walls, being less of a run and gun hero - Instead, more reserved, tactical. No matter your style, you will die. A lot. Even on normal. This will frustrate but not enough for it to bypass the frustration threshold that turns a game from 'must do better - I want to progress' to 'want to throw this game out of the f'ing window ugh!'

It has that right balance between repeat death to adapt and overcome, while you still have the tools to be a complete badass doing it. Spare painkillers? Good! That guy who just shot you point blank in the face with a shotgun is going to put you in last-man-standing mode, which will give you a second wind on those freak incidents where you find yourself overwhelmed out of nowhere.

All in all, MP3 is Max Payne - With enough bells and whistles to justify it being apart from the previous two, but not enough for it to not be Max Payne. Those who debate that the non-grim city dark environments detract from the noir underappreciate just how gorgeous this game looks and how you don't need to have a leather jacket wearing guy ranting in the rain of a gang infested american city all day for it to be Noir.

Buy this game - Enter bullet time - Go shoot people in the eyesocket. You'll love it.

reviewText:
Best Third Person Shooter in Recent Years

The title says it all. Story wise, it's good. Max is is as sardonic and bitter as ever, and his one liners tend to stick with you for a while. Max's original voice actor is still in this game, and he's still a fantastic fit, and the rest of the voice acting is solid. The story has some interesting twists and turns, but it can be confusing at times.

The graphics are fantastic. This is easily the best looking game that Rockstar has made. Every sequence and cutscene is a visual treat filled with some great attention to detail, comeplete with being able to totally decimate an office with bullets.

The music and sound is great too. Great VA as said earlier, and the group HEALTH makes a great score for a game like this.

The gameplay is what makes this the best third person shooter I have played recently. The action  always keeps you moving, defying the annoying keep in cover or die" trope. Mooks will flank you if you stay in one place

reviewText: It's Max Payne and it offers everything you'd wish from a Max Payne game. It has some of the best graphics I've seen in any game ever and it really makes me surprised that it ran decently well on my computer (note that I clearly didn't have everything on max). I need to say that the game is pretty much as similar as it would be in the last Max Payne games, the only difference is that there are no more Graphic Novels and it depends too much on the cover system. Sometimes you just miss being able to run through hordes of thugs without caring much about anything, but nonetheless it's a great game.

reviewText: Max Payne 3 is a very special Max Payne game. Its no longer in the dark setting of the streets of new york in winter, it now plays  in ♥♥♥♥ing Rio de Janero. Max Payne is no longer a cop, he's now a bodyguard for a wealthy family, but that does not mean he has stopped the drugs, the booze and the smokes. The story is about a gangster clan wich kidnaps the daughter of your boss. While Max risks his life often enough to find her, he discovers the streets and background"-crimes of brazil and also a few plot twists about bad guys lying and ♥♥♥♥.\n\nThe story is a bit thin compared to the previous games
date: especially those moments where you don't really care about a few important characters of the story.\n\nThe gameplay is very similiar to the previous games. Max shoots his way through tons of badies while using bullet time and pain killers
recommended: a very fun combination that has always worked good. One point is a bit sad though: You can only carry 2 handguns and a 2 handed weapon (and if you dual-equip the 2 handguns you actually drop your big gun). I personally think the massive amounts of guns you could carry and use whenever you wanted from the previous games were a better solution. Also there are no more grenades for you to use. Allllllso: no more quicksaving. A bit stupid if you have to fight the same hoard of enemies again and again :C\n\nThe game has a very high graphic standard. Most of the time you'll have high quality textures and good exploding effects. The voice acting is good
hoursPlayed: especially the monologues of Max burn into your memory. The soundtrack on the other hand is a "funky" version of the original soundtrack. I kind of dislike this
voteText: the "hawaii five-o"-theme song would probably been better...this is no longer a "sad" max payne
helpfulPercent: its a "depressed and angry" max payne in a zoo full of partying gay flamingos.\n\nConclusion: I recommend the game for the sake of having max payne gameplay
votesHelpful: while I dislike most of the setting of the game. There are a few flashbacks that play in New York
votesTotal: but its just never the same anymore."

reviewText:
The BEST third person shooter I have played to date.

First off, there's the actual shooting itself. The gunplay and combat is amazing in this game. It plays out like a blockbuster action movie, with you controlling the star. It's just so fun, satisfying and brutal. The way bodies colapse and debris is kicked up adds to the atmosphere. Everything in this game feels real. Graphically, it looks very good. The environments are incredibly detailed, as are the characters and weapons. Storywise, it's pretty good to. Although it's not really linked to the previous 2 games in many ways (although it does tie in at times), the story (which I won't ruin) is relitavley compelling and wouldn't seem out of place in a movie, which is what this game feels and plays like - a full throttle action packed movie, and an amazing one at that.

I honestly couldn't reccomend it more.

I went into this game with bit of doubt.Im glad to say that doubt was gone after 15 min of gameplay.

In my oppinion the game is very very well made.
Story is gripping and does not disapoint
I loved the voice acting and tha narator aspect of the game.
Scenery and graphics are great as well.

And what i loved the most ( U almost never see that in games )
was that nearly all enemy chat between themselves wasnt in english
and no subtitels for it.This made combat very very interesting and fun.
Sence that kept you guessing and more vigilant of what the enemy might do.
And even when you died the enemy didnt take the same action as before
So that added a huge amount to the combat system in the game.

There were some things what i did not like as well
for instance sometimes the enemy forces were too overwhelming and
the pile of corpses u create is enough to pave the streets of Brazil
But all and all it is a great game

Hope this helps someone to decide to play it.

I personaly give this game 9/10

It is a Must Play

reviewText:
A pretty solid shooter with a good amount of variety, though I do I have a few gripes about it.

Excellent narrative; everything Max says throughout the game is spot on, and there's no shortage of it.

That said, the gameplay is pretty much entirely based around using your bullet-time to get headshots, so keep that in mind as you play it. Any shots that are not in the head feel like you're just wasting bullets.

I'm not a fan of the checkpoint system and really miss any sort of quicksave and quickload options. It makes it significantly harder to optimize your play.

The control also feels a lot looser" than previous Max Payne games. I'm sure this is played up as Max being older and far less agile
date: but it can still feel a bit frustrating just the same.\n\nOverall
recommended: it's certainly worth getting if only to hear Max's thoughts on this newest human cesspool of crime."

reviewText:
**You'll find this review at my blog also - http://riksreaction.blogspot.co.uk/**

I recently finished the final chapter of the Max Payne story and I think I liked it! However... I have come away with some mixed feelings...

So firstly what is Max Payne 3? Well you play as the Max in the title, an ex NYPD cop who after the events of the first two games finds himself with his wife and baby murdered, his best friend dead and another woman he grew to care about shot in the back. Sooo understandably, this leaves Max carrying some hefty emotional baggage around with him, a suitcase made of scar tissue, full of regrets.

He's life weary cynicism personified, he's been through too much.. seen too much and no matter how hard he tries to find redemption or a way out of his own internal pain... things just seem to get from bad to worse.

Max Payne is probably the most apt name for a character ever conceived.

However he is also hard as nails and a master of film noir metaphor, believe me you'll come away from this game with a gritty one liner for nearly any situation. For example...

Max - “I didn’t know what to think any more. This town had more smoke and mirrors than a strip club locker room.

Use that one next time your confused about something

Now... about those mixed feelings I have.

On one hand this game oozes style. The gun play and fire fights just "look" cool and at times almost appear choreographed in the way they play out

reviewText: One of the best third-person shooters I have ever played. Bullet time works perfectly! The story is good, although it's inconsistent at times. Visuals are gorgeous: level of details and character models are really impressive. There are plenty of cut-scenes, for some it's a minus, although I personally love them. In general, it's an interesting sequel to two classical games. I loved it, thus recommend it to all people who love really good action game.

reviewText:
Upon finishing this game and playing a few rounds of multiplayer, I can finally say this game is wonderful, but sadly, it's underestimated. The gameplay is wonderful, but it may be a bit hard if it's your first time playing (took me 2 hours to finally understand how to play this game) but once you get the hang of it, it'll be ezpz. The story-line could be better and bigger since it's like a tad bit short. ):

I bought it for 4€ I think on a steam sale some time ago and it was worth it, and to be honest, 20€ is an actually very reasonable price.

If you have the chance to buy this game, do so, you will not regret it. But if you're counting on playing only multiplayer and ♥♥♥♥ on the single player you will be disappointed since multiplayer is dead as ♥♥♥, but if you do find a multiplayer lobby, you'll be amazed because multiplayer is very smooth and cool.

Buy it. gogogogo grab 20€ and buy it.

voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Gameplay

Max Payne 3 differs a lot from the earlier entries. It feels a little faster paced, which does not make it worse or better. Of course bullet time has returned and it's better than ever before! Seeing bullets go through your foe's head slowly is very enjoyable! The main story is interesting enough to make you want to proceed and this game desperately needed that. The game is nothing more then shooting enemies and proceeding to the next area. The shooting part is great and there are many different ways to execute parts so that makes the game still fun to play. And to be honest, I didn't feel like it was as repetitive as it may sound. The cutscenes are very interesting and fun to watch with top-notch voice acting. After you complete the main story, which is around 10 hours. You have arcade mode and a great multiplayer mode to mess around with. Nothing too special but it does make the game last quite a bit longer!

Graphics

This game looks amazing! even on the lowest settings most things still look very crisp and clean... well until you make another bloodbath of course Wink. Graphical wise this game amazed me. The only game I can think of with better looking graphics is L.A. Noire!

Multiplayer

The multiplayer didn't do a lot for me, but it's solid. There are not that many maps, but the ones that are there are great. The way bullet time is implemented is great and works. Kudos for that. But all in all the multiplayer is just a solid experience, nothing that really blows your mind.

Story

The story, just like the earlier entries, is told in an unique way which I personally really enjoy. The story really makes you care for Max and yes, it is definitely depressing. And the ending is also worth it. While all of this sounds like I'm amazed by it, I am not really, It's great, don't get me wrong. But the story falls short at some points. I had a few moments which I found a little cliché. But other than that the story is interesting enough to keep you playing.

Addons

There is quite some dlc for the game. some DLC whilst being very cool, Is pretty expensive and you don't really get much in return in comparison. And I am very disappointed in one of the DLC's. Quote:  higher damage bullets in Max Payne 3 multiplayer". This makes purchasing DLC make you have an advantage in multiplayer which is not a good thing!

Value

The price tag has dropped to roughly $35 for the complete pack on pc. The game is worth it. I have played it for aroun 65 hours and I don't think about playing it again anytime soon. So it's definitely worth the money!

Verdict

Rockstar once again drops a solid game on the market. Though it has a few weak points nothing really makes the game unenjoyable or unplayable. It's even better if you play the first 2 entries in the series first just for the story's sake! I'd recommend this game to most people!"

reviewText:
I am not sure if I like this game too much. I've already started my 3rd playthrough and I am absolutely loving this game!
Why? I am not sure. I guess I find shooting people in slow motion enjoyable! This game isn't far too hard and not too easy. I first played on easy and it still gave me a challenge. I played on medium and it gave a more balanced challenge. Also the detail in this game is simply AMAZING. The game let's you explore alot, even though it isn't open world so that was pretty cool.

I mostly liked this game for the gameplay due to the fact I've never played other Max Payne games, but as sure as hell this got me interested in the first two games. The story was pretty simple: Ex-cop is now a bodyguard who has alcohol and painkiller addiction is supposed to protect a rich family in South America. And obviously there is some problems on the way which lead to bigger problems. So the story was pretty easy to follow. Also I like the fact that it's narrated by Max and that's why everything tends to sound pretty cool.

I can't find too much bad in this game expect the effects. All of those DARN effects in the cutscenes. I can't see the point in them! Those effects make me sick and make me want to throw up.

For short: An amazing game that makes me want to buy the older Max Payne games and also gives you a beautiful view of Sao Paulo. The effects can be annoying.

This game does not deserve the marks it has received. Buggy (see my play date), repetitive to annoyance, and stupid mechanics that left you losing your weapons all the time, switching them all the time, and cover mechanics that were as bad as any of the worst.

Best thing about this game? Bullet time. Worst thing? Everything else.

reviewText:
Max Payne 3 is a decent shooting game that is hard to find these days: great cover mechanics, slow-mo and of course, lots of pain killers. Story wise, it does tell an interesting enough story to keep you engaged throughout the game with a bit of politics, the rich here, the poor there, etc. That said, it is nowhere near its predecessors; almost everything I love was taken away: The noire atmosphere, the stylist comic-like mission intros, the nightmares, hallucination, the rainy, pissy NYC nights...

The multiplayer mode - frankly, I don't care much about it - is okay; it has a level-up system with cool perks, character/weapon customization and a few modes for you to practice slo-mo shooting - yeah, slo-mo shooting in multiplayer mode. Still, I couldn't get into it; guess I suck that much.

Please don't give up your hope just yet, like I mentioned earlier, Max Payne 3, in the end, is still a very good shooter. Just try and you'll see for yourself.

reviewText: This game is a peak of evolution of Max Payne series. It has astounding graphics and so many different levels filled with amazing number of details. The action gameplay is maybe best in genre: cinematic picture and incredible bullet- and body-physics makes it extremely addictive. Although you may not like what Houser brothers did to a character, in the end its all makes sense: noir winter of the almost psychotic ex-cop with nothing to loose ----> noir autumn of the man who tried to start new life and who lost his newfound love for the second time ----> post-noir summer of tired old man, who just wanted to escape his past but was embroiled in viscous plot again. For the last time, i hope - this person deserves some rest and this series just cant get any better.

reviewText:
First of all, this game is just gorgeous. On max settings it has to be one of the best looking games I have ever seen. As well as the graphics, Rockstar should be praised on the amount of detail this game has (though that shouldn't be a surprise). The game seems to be optimised very well, also. It runs very smoothly and is one of the more pleasant
PC gaming experiences I have had.

Having never previously played any previous instalments in the Max Payne franchise, I picked up Max Payne 3 not knowing what to expect, but I do have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed the single player campaign, and I do believe the game is worth its full retail price. If you can pick it up during a sale, then you're laughing. The gun controls in Grand Theft Auto IV are very sticky, but they have been fixed here, so no need to worry. Although it does have partial controller support, I would just use the mouse and keyboard as this title is not an open world game.

As for the multiplayer, well, it's not my thing, but I have played a little bit of it and I do appreciate it. Bullet Time does actually work well, too.

reviewText:
It's not quite Max Payne 1 and 2 but it's definitely a great game on its own merit.

The voice and character of Max returns but the writing and dialogue isn't quite as clever and creative and sadly the graphic novel style intermissions between acts do not make a comeback. Add to this a distinct lack of a dark, snow-blasted New York City and the game fails to deliver the Noire-esque experience fans of the series had come to expect.

What the game lacks however it makes up for in visceral, unforgiving gunplay and raw style. It has great visuals and a kick-♥♥♥ soundtrack to boot.

Definitely worth playing through at least once or twice.

reviewText: I will have to admit that on first impressions I was sceptical to say the least about Max Payne 3 and I was disappointed that they had left behind most of the 'film noire' and gritty aspects of the first two games. However, I put my faith in Rockstar; and what a wait it has been. This is truly one of the best games I've ever played, I am an absolute fan of third person shooters and really love GTA and this is just incredible. The shooting, the bullet time, the metaphorical and amazing voice work by James McCaffrey is truly a work of art. I would advise anyone to buy this game, it'll get you addicted for many hours after the main story with the intense multiplayer action. I've completed every difficulty and done everything there is to the game, and I'm still playing the game, even after 100+ hours of play. I love it, and I think it still has the best shooting within a video game, better than anything imaginable, this is the sort of game that lives on forever and ever. Max Payne's life and story is so influential and heart aching that I feel like I am that character, that despite Max Payne's bad fortune, we all suffer in the same way he does. The depressing feeling of losing people all around you. The vengeance and anger we self contain, it is within us all and it's not going to stop the feelings you get from this game. Truly a work of art, and the narrative is so superb in the way that is done by James McCaffery that really nothing could compare.

I actually pre-ordered this game, hoping it would be a perfect follow-up from the magical hands at Rockstar. Not everything they touch change in gold, same goes for this game. reviewText:
Max Payne 3 is a decent shooting game that is hard to find these days: great cover mechanics, slow-mo and of course, lots of pain killers. Story wise, it does tell an interesting enough story to keep you engaged throughout the game with a bit of politics, the rich here, the poor there, etc. That said, it is nowhere near its predecessors; almost everything I love was taken away: The noire atmosphere, the stylist comic-like mission intros, the nightmares, hallucination, the rainy, pissy NYC nights...

The multiplayer mode - frankly, I don't care much about it - is okay; it has a level-up system with cool perks, character/weapon customization and a few modes for you to practice slo-mo shooting - yeah, slo-mo shooting in multiplayer mode. Still, I couldn't get into it; guess I suck that much.

Please don't give up your hope just yet, like I mentioned earlier, Max Payne 3, in the end, is still a very good shooter. Just try and you'll see for yourself.

I looked up start up issues on the forum, it stated that the social club drivers aren't up to date, I go through C: into steam/ maxpayne ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t trying to update the social club drivers, with no success.
I found other vidoes online saying we need to update with a crack, yet the videos using this crack were from pirated copies downloaded through U torrent, I purchased mine through steam, and regret it as it's way too much work and frustration just to play a decent/ not ground breaking game.

reviewText:
This is one of the best shooters I have ever played. The gameplay and gunfights are flawless. It has one of the better soundtracks that will get you pumped and wanting to kill. The game is hard because it is not a corridor shooter, if you stay behind walls for too long, you will be in trouble. The game rewards being ballsy and going all out. I highly recommend playing this game!
Downside: Loading screens/cut scenes are really long, this makes it painful to re-play the game.

reviewText:
Em geral não se compara aos primeiros jogos da série, mas é um ótimo jogo de tiro em terceira pessoa. A história me prendeu bastante (não tanto como a do primeiro jogo, mas mais do que a do segundo), e pelo jogo se situar quase que inteiramente no Brasil, para nós brasileiros tem um gosto especial!

Às vezes a dublagem de alguns personagens deixou a desejar (com português de Portugal e com dublagem ruim em si em português brasileiro mesmo), mas em compensação a de outros estava muito real, nível Cidade de Deus/Tropa de Elite.

As fases estão muito bem trabalhadas, em especial estive no Canal do Panamá e a reconstituição está quase perfeita. A jogabilidade em alguns momentos me atrapalhou em vez de ajudar, mas como o bullet time é divertido do começo ao fim de qualquer jeito, isso não chegou a incomodar tanto.

Enfim, dou 7,5. Um ótimo jogo de ação/aventura, espero que venha mais!

reviewText:
Solid entry from a new developer in the Max Payne series.  New environments and a more varied color palette feel juxtaposed with Max Payne at first, but the constant cheesy 'P.I.' voice-over quickly brings you back into familiar territory.

I didn't try the multiplayer.

The campaign is about 10 hours long.  By the end you'll be a little tired of the repetitiveness.  The game also tended to intersperse longish cutscenes throughout each level, which can be frustrating when you're ready to progress (and actually play).  But overall, the controls are tight and the gameplay is satisfying during combat.

reviewText: I have been playing Max Payne ever since my balls dropped. One of my favorite series ever in the history of ever! (heart) Minky Pinky for life! The story behind this game is compelling, the game play was as fluid and righteous as this diarrhea I got once and the graphics are so good I started making out with my screen. GET THIS GAME! PLAY IT! LOVE IT!\n\nOn to a more serious note: Follow your own path. Choose different role models. How can you relate to these silly video game characters? The person speaking such nonsense I guess has never been blessed enough to relate to someone so beautiful. Ever since my 360 red ringed I was pretty sad I couldn't play Max Payne 3... Max is more than polygons, pixels, zeroes and ones. Max Payne has been someone I respect and related to since I was young. To watch a man go from the perfect life to such a tragic downfall was a heartbreaking experience to witness. I was shielded from the emotional aspect of videogames. Crash Bandicoot and Spyro never once got an emotional response out of me, but Max was one of the first. Who would have thought that in my adult life I would take from his experience and learn that despite all the pain and hardships you can move on and do what you think is right in life. If the game can end with him being happy with himself as a person and the opportunity for more, why can't I think that way? If you have ever played Max Payne, you know the man has had some struggles and hard times. If you know anything about my life, you'd know I have faced many hardships as well. If Max can do it, so can I!

reviewText:
Max Payne 3 is a decent shooting game that is hard to find these days: great cover mechanics, slow-mo and of course, lots of pain killers. Story wise, it does tell an interesting enough story to keep you engaged throughout the game with a bit of politics, the rich here, the poor there, etc. That said, it is nowhere near its predecessors; almost everything I love was taken away: The noire atmosphere, the stylist comic-like mission intros, the nightmares, hallucination, the rainy, pissy NYC nights...

The multiplayer mode - frankly, I don't care much about it - is okay; it has a level-up system with cool perks, character/weapon customization and a few modes for you to practice slo-mo shooting - yeah, slo-mo shooting in multiplayer mode. Still, I couldn't get into it; guess I suck that much.

Please don't give up your hope just yet, like I mentioned earlier, Max Payne 3, in the end, is still a very good shooter. Just try and you'll see for yourself.

reviewText: Although Max Payne series purists might find reason to complain about Max Payne 3, for newcomers or those who are open to change, the game is excellent.\nThe story is a dark one- a tale of kidnappings, murders, betrayals, conspiracy, greed, and oppression. If you've played Grand Theft Auto IV, the style will be familiar, for this game and GTA4 share the same writer.\nOn a technical level, the game is polished to a mirror sheen. Rockstar has redeemed themselves when it comes to PC ports- the game has next to no technical flaws, the controls all work as intended, the graphics are beautiful, and the loadtimes are reasonably quick. The framerate remains a smooth 60, and for once, Max Payne 3 takes advantage of multiple cores and other oft-neglected features from day 1. Aim assist defaults to its off" setting
date: greatly reducing aiming frustration and making shootdodges and bullet-time a blast.\nOverall
recommended: I strongly recommend this game for Max Payne veterans and newcomers alike."

reviewText: Stunning looking game with a decent vibe to it. The combat model is pretty impressive (shooting from prone is particularly well done) , but does require a bit of getting used to it. I recommend doing a chapter or two dry run initially so you get used to using the bullet time mechanic and when to instigate it. Story doesn't really contain a huge amount of surprises to be honest, though the signposting isn't as egregious as in GTA IV, and overall the writing is as hard boiled as one would expect from a Max Payne game.\n\nThe game suffers from a couple of difficulty spikes in places, and the body count does get a tad ridiculous at times (New York could've done with a lot less targets overall I feel), however it is an action shooter so overboard numbers is to be expected. I’ve not played the MP so I can’t comment on that, however if you’re looking for something shooty to keep you occupied I’d give a thumbs up.

reviewText:
My Personal GOTY TPS for 2012.

If you played the previous installments you'll already have a feel for our anti-hero, Max. He's a moody, drug and alcohol addicted detective...except in this one he is retired, and living in Sao Paulo, Brazil working as a security guard for the wealthy Bronco family.

This game is ultra story-heavy, with top-notch voice and motion capture working seamlessly together throughout the entire game. There is murder, there is mystery, there is heart-pounding suspense, and there is always a rainstorm of bullets being rained down upon you. I guarantee you a good time.

It has a fresh take on gun mechanics, improving upon the franchises already implemented control scheme. You can dual wield two single-handed weapons and carry one two-handed weapon at all times. You have a slow motion gauge that fills up from getting kills and you can use it while you run and gun, duck for cover, dive forward, backward, sideways, down stairwells, you name it - Max can do it if you can.
This installment also gives a new feature called Last Man Standing" wherein someone shoots you fatally
date: you have until you hit the ground to find them on screen and shoot them
recommended:
granting you a painkiller upon success.

Max Payne 3 is a non-stop action thrillride that will have you playing until the end with sweaty palms.

Other features include extra game modes: Score Attack - where you go through completed chapters racking up the most points as possible; New York Minute - you have one minute on the clock to complete each chapter...good luck.

Multiplayer is functional
hoursPlayed: as of 5/27/15 I can still find games."

reviewText:
Max Payne 3 (even though the series as a whole as well) is golden action game material.

If you like to shoot mobsters, get this game.
If you like amazing story and dialogue, get this game.
If you like amazing shooting mechanics and realistic character animations, get this game.

for 13 years I have been a huge Max Payne fan, and I have been amazed with the games since childhood.
It never gets old.  Ive beaten Max Payne 3 multiple times on console, and 1 and 1/2 times on pc (currently playing on hard).
Collecting all the evidence and golden guns to replay the game thugged out with golden weapons adds plenty of replayability.  And the gameplay is so great that it doesn't wear out its welcome.

Buy this game.  Buy all of them.  Payne to the max.

10/10

reviewText: I walked down a deserted alley, feeling like two eggs scorched by the hot sun and the looming threat of death over my head. I looked out from my personal hell to see something truly terrifying. That was the local goodwill. The cesspit of forgotten dreams picked up by the new age of the hip young generation. I took 4 seconds to open a door. Then, I took another 4 seconds to open a few more doors. I went straight to the gadgets and gizmos section and there it was for $3.99. Poor soul must have been priced by an elderly woman who lost both her arms to Marfan syndrome. As I started intently at the box is almost spoke to me. There I was living the American Dream with a cheap copy of Max Payne 3 under my belt. Booted the disk in the old toaster. But my mind was in so many places. All these years of glancing back at the past and never looking and the disaster that played out right in front of me. In a haze, I couldn't enter the product key and the box sat there like a narwhal with a couple extra kidneys squirming around out of water as a means of entertainment. But when the steam sale ship was in full motion giving more and more money to the high and mighty crippling the weak, like an advertisement on a late night TV show for finacial compensation that comes with 4 free copies of the final season of Weeds ripped off Jeffrey Dahmer's hard drive covered in the remorseful tears of a suicide bomber who works for a religious cult that believes Tex Murphy is secretly Tim Blake Nelson, who got drunk and dressed like Indiana Jones after rewatching ♥♥♥♥ Tracy 32 times but instead of ♥♥♥♥ Tracy the main character was a cardboard cutout of Billy Mays with the voice of that guy from the shamwow TV ads. As I waited for the game to download I noticed that it was taking an awfully long time like watching pieces of cheese try to reproduce through osmosis. I decieded to get a drink, and another, and another, and before I knew it my life was in a downward spiral. Life told me to accept social club. But Life never accepted me. It was one uninstall and that was it. There was no hope for me. I opened a few doors, and then I opened some more doors and yelled at people because I was dark and gritty feeling like the Tequilla was taking a toll on my like Charlie Sheen does to my neighbors' fouton when he's taken time out of his day to sell drugs to government agents. This was my experience... but now it's my life\n\n(TL;DR: If you like lots of cutscenes and nonsense about talking to yourself along with the most satisfying gunplay ever you should try this game as long as social hub isn't being its awful self)

reviewText:
After a long, nine-year-long sleep, Max returns with all the galantry and badassery we´ve come to expect, but this time he does so with some cool new additions which elevate this third entry above its two counterparts.

Some flashback sequences aside, the action has shifted from the cold, dark alleys of New York to the sun-soaked favelas of Brazil, a first in the series, and boy does it suit the franchise well. This setting is Rockstar´s perfect opportunity to boast some incredibly detailed scenarios and astounding lighting effects, not to mention Max´s life-like reactions and breathtaking cinematics.

The story, while engaging from the get-go, does get somewhat muddled by the end, with several different names flying by without giving you a second to give a face to them, but then again, the story has always shared this trait in the previous offerings. What never gets old are Max´s quirky remarks dotted throughout the 12-hour-long campaign, which have become a trademark of the cop´s adventures. The visual design works wonders with the narrative feel, as key words are highlighted when a cutscene hits, giving the title a distinct feel above other, more generic third person shooters.

Of course, what would Max Payne be without bullet time? Dead, that´s what. But fear not, because this aspect which made the first two games so appealing is back, now packed with more over-the-top situations in which to try it out. A cover sistem has been introduced for the first time, and it feels way more natural than just standing behind corners like a big ol´ chump the Max from nine years ago did. Also, this time you actually see your character taking painkillers, instead of just magically regenerating your health for no apparent reason. These cool new features, added to the increase in guns and varied level design, give the title at hand a new dose of realism, to the point you actually feel this guy could totally exist in the real world.

Last, and most probably least, is the multiplayer portion. While it carries over the amazing slo-mo kills and over-the-top action, it can´t help but feel tacked-on, a way to lengthen the game´s overall duration, but definitely not in a good way. It does provide a fun few hours, but that´s probably all you will spend in it.

Overall, Max Payne 3 is an amazing experience, proving Rockstar is not only the master of open-world games, but also really good at trying its hand at relentless, third-person action. It could use a bit of tweaking here and there, and the multiplayer portion could have been better implemented, but that shouldn´t distract you from what this game really is: a fantastic, dazzling, non-stop thriller which will grab hold of you and won´t let go until you see it through.

Pros:

+ Intriguing, if somewhat muddled, story
+ Fantastic audiovisual design
+ Max´s character, a fascinating insight into one of gaming´s most beloved anti-heroes
+ Bullet-time and all the spectacle it provides
+ Social Club integration
+ Voice acting is once again top-notch

Cons:

- Lackluster multiplayer
- Some of Max´s remarks don´t quite impress like they used to back in the day
- A co-op mode would have been gratefully accepted

Final grade: 9.4 (Amazing)

reviewText: Good game.  Good story. Good action. Plenty of options to get it for a good price.\n\nThe mechanics and controls on the game are solid.  The weapons handle (for the most part) well except for a few that make you zoom down the sites.  The game was ment with 3rd person looking like a badass in mind so its easy to see where the POV guns dont work well.   However if you are looking for realistic" gunplay go look somewhere else. This should be obvious if you know anything about the bullet time inducing Max Payne series
date: but sometimes it actually made me laugh.   Plenty of times I was inches away from death from a fireing squad of assult rifles or machinegun nest only to be saved by the few plywood boards at my back.  Made me chuckle.\n\nThe story is top notch and the facial expressions and voice acting are all very well done.   Some of the plot can be a bit predicable and some of the actions from the characters dont make sense
recommended: but these are not characters known for thinking out situations.  Thats apart of the fantasy of this game.  Get in and get to shooting is what this is about.\n\n"

reviewText: Intense, emotionally satsifying and equally draining. Max Payne is a superb game with Rockstar dishing out a real masterclass in delivery and presentation. Load this up on a good rig to really show it off.
